text: Is there a way to deploy the project and set a --legacy-peer-deps flag to the build command?

If you update your package.json for npm run start to be `hs project upload` without the extra argument for the directory, does it work?

And can you share what version of the hs cli you have?  `hs --version`

Thanks for responding!

The version is 7.0.1

And this is what I get when running deploy without the dir argument
This is the npm package. The upload:Hubl command actually works fine and uploads to my design manager. Only deploy is giving me the issue.
Sure thing!  I am going to make sure we log this issue which so far looks like it relates to the newest version of the hs cli (v7, which you are using)
Hmmm. So downgrading should resolve the issue?
I believe so.  But as a workaround can you also try running the command from your theme directory (where another package.json exists, I think your hello-world-app)
This is the package.json file in the hello-world-app dir. It does not look like it has an upload command
^ JFYI, I'm running into a similar issue and running from the root package.json
Can you cd into it and just run `hs project upload` directly?
running from the project/app folder works
to be clear <@U088F7XCX3Q>, in terminal I did `cd project/app` (this might be different for you)

Thanks for confirming <@UDHT6N5SM>

Hopefully that workaround does it for the time being while we work out the right fix
Ok great.  Sorry for the inconvenience, will let ya know when we get a resolution here so the normal npm command works
Thanks so much for your help!

Hey guys. When you upload project should you be seeing it in your developer account along with other projects? I am seeing something in the docs that would indicate as such, but I cannot find the hello-world project in the design manager, nor can I find it in my developer portal with the rest of my projects?
